p: Although MEO Fl and MEO Lv did not activate the hTRPV1 or hTRPV4 channels, we still evaluated the major monoterpene constituents of these essential oils in HEK hTRPV1 and hTRPV4 cells. Real-time [Ca 2+] i assessment in HEK hTRPV1 ( Figure 6A) and hTRPV4 cells ( Figure 6B) showed that 100 µM of carvacrol, thymol, β-myrcene, α-terpinene, and γ-terpinene had no effect on baseline [Ca 2+] i in either transfected cell line. We used 100 µM concentrations to evaluate the responses of these TRP channels, since this concentration fully activated TRPA1 and was clearly in the plateau of the dose response. As controls, capsaicin and GSK-1016790A were used to confirm the functional expression of TRPV1 and TRPV4, respectively. Summarized data showing the significant differences in [Ca 2+] i between the agonists and monoterpenes are shown in Figure 6C,D for HEK hTRPV1 and hTRPV4, respectively.
